00020 #ifndef REFPOINTER_H_
00021 #define REFPOINTER_H_
00022 
00023 #ifdef VS_DEBUG
00024 #include <assert.h>
00025 #endif
00026 #include <com/xuggle/ferry/RefCounted.h>
00027 namespace com { namespace xuggle { namespace ferry
00028   {
00029 
00046   template <class T> class RefPointer
00047   {
00048   public:
00052     RefPointer() : mPtr(0)
00053     {
00054     }
00055 
00067     RefPointer(T* ptr) : mPtr(ptr)
00068     {
00069     }
00070 
00080     RefPointer(const RefPointer& rPtr) : mPtr(rPtr.mPtr)
00081     {
00082       VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00083     }
00090     RefPointer(RefPointer& rPtr) : mPtr(rPtr.mPtr)
00091     {
00092       VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00093     }
00094 
00102     RefPointer& operator=(const RefPointer& rPtr)
00103     {
00104       reset(static_cast<T*>(rPtr.mPtr));
00105       VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00106       return *this;
00107     }
00108 
00116     RefPointer& operator=(RefPointer& rPtr)
00117     {
00118       reset(static_cast<T*>(rPtr.mPtr));
00119       VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00120       return *this;
00121     }
00122 
00138     RefPointer& operator=(T* ptr)
00139     {
00140       reset(ptr);
00141       return *this;
00142     }
00143 
00153     T* operator->() const
00154     {
00155       // we don't protect against a null defer here.
00156       return static_cast<T*>(mPtr);
00157     }
00158 
00159 
00173     operator bool()
00174     {
00175       return mPtr!=0;
00176     }
00177 
00181     virtual ~RefPointer()
00182     {
00183   #ifdef VS_DEBUG
00184       {
00185         if (mPtr)
00186         {
00187           // This check should never fail in a multi-thread
00188           // environment, even though the underlying
00189           // objects ref can change.
00190           // If the object is bad, this should cause
00191           // a READ error in memory tools
00192           int refCount = mPtr->getCurrentRefCount();
00193           assert(refCount >= 1);
00194         }
00195       }
00196   #endif // VS_DEBUG
00197       VS_REF_RELEASE(mPtr);
00198     }
00199 
00206     T* get()
00207     {
00208       VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00209       return static_cast<T*>(mPtr);
00210     }
00211 
00226     T* value()
00227     {
00228       return static_cast<T*>(mPtr);
00229     }
00230 
00237     void reset(T* ptr=0, bool acquire=false)
00238     {
00239       VS_REF_RELEASE(mPtr);
00240       mPtr = ptr;
00241       if (acquire)
00242         VS_REF_ACQUIRE(mPtr);
00243     }
00244   private:
00245     // And the underlying thing we manage.
00246     // Must derive from RefCounted; We used to keep
00247     // a RefCounted here, but it's much nicer to
00248     // a debugger if you keep the actual type here.
00249     T *mPtr;
00250   };
00251 
00252   }}}
00253 
00254 #endif /*REFPOINTER_H_*/
